item.title: Final projects
item.description: Contents Natalia Brown: Analysis of travel runs in Yellowstone Dan Sisco: Firefighter fatalities, 2000–2015 Whitney Royal: European hotel reviews Jordan Hunter: Severe workplace injuries in the United States, 2015–2017 James Sinkovic: Assassinations on the rise? Christopher Law: European hotel reviews Jacob Fullmer: Chase Bank nationwide deposit trends, 2010–2016 Stephanie Dossena: Trends in terrorism, 1970–2010 Victor Obiri: Breaking down terrorism in the US For their final projects, students had to use R and Illustrator to take a huge dataset, explore it, tinker with it, and tell a nuanced story about it using at least three graphs.

item.title: Tentative Schedule
item.description: The schedule covers eight sessions between February and April. The sessions are designed to be modular, so if you don’t prefer to attend the orientation and setup session, for example, you can skip it and still keep on track with the other sessions. Almost all of the sessions come with readings, interactive worksheets, and extra exercises. The readings should be completed before the session they’re assigned to. I will be making assumptions about prior knowledge based on the readings, so please try to complete them ahead of time.
